docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Welcome to the documentation of banco, a simple, lightweight and performant item-based economy plugin designed for the needs of the modern Minecraft server.

You can download banco from Modrinth or SpigotMC, as well as our GitHub releases page.

Feel free to join our Discord server if you are having trouble while setting up the plugin.

docs.title: Jump right in
docs.text:
• Quickstart

    Installing and setting up banco

  • Commands

    List of commands and permissions

  • FAQ

    Frequently asked questions

docs.title: Setting everything up
docs.text:
Before starting to use the API, you will have to add the JitPack repository and the dependency to your project:

<repositories>
    <repository>
        <id>jitpack.io</id>
        <url>https://jitpack.io</url>
    </repository>
</repositories>

<dependencies>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.github.myth-MC.banco</groupId>
        <artifactId>banco-api</artifactId>
        <version>VERSION</version>
    </dependency>
</dependencies>

You can now get the Banco instance by using the Banco class:

Banco banco = Banco.get();

This instance provides access to every function in the plugin.

docs.title: Accounts
docs.text:
An Account stores a player's UUID and its balance amount. It is loaded from banco's database each time the server starts or a reload is triggered into the AccountManager.

You can deposit or withdraw a specific amount of money from an account by using banco's AccountManager:

docs.title: Getting an Account by UUID
docs.text:
You can get an Accountby getting the AccountManagerfrom the previously retrieved Banco instance:

AccountManager accountManager = banco.getAccountManager();

Now you can get an account matching a player's UUID by doing this:

Account account = accountManager.get(uuid);

Warning

If there is no Account matching the UUID, Account will be null. You must run the necessary checks in your code before proceeding.

docs.title: Depositing money into an account
docs.text:
Now that you have an Account you can deposit a specific amount of money into it. This amount must be a BigDecimal.

BigDecimal amount = BigDecimal.valueOf("-1.5");
accountManager.deposit(account, amount);

docs.title: Withdrawing money from an account
docs.text:
You can also withdraw money by using the method AccountManager::withdraw:

accountManager.withdraw(account, amount);

docs.title: Items
docs.text: BancoItem represents an item that has a value in banco's economy. It can be converted to a Bukkit ItemStack with the BancoItem::asItemStack method.

docs.title: Supporting items from other plugins
docs.text:
Other plugins can make their items compatible with banco very easily by creating a record that implements BancoItem. Here is a full example:

public record ItemsAdderBancoItem(String identifier, BigDecimal value) implements BancoItem {

    @Override
    public ItemStack asItemStack(int amount) {
        ItemStack itemStack = CustomStack.getInstance(identifier).getItemStack();
        itemStack.setAmount(amount);
        return itemStack;
    }

}

Server owners can now use ItemsAdderBancoItem as a valid item loader:

settings.yml
  itemRegistry:
  - type: ItemsAdderBancoItem
    identifier: example_identifier
    value: '1'

docs.title: Getting a BancoItem from an ItemStack
docs.text:
You can get a BancoItem from an ItemStack by using the BancoItemRegistry::get method:

BancoItemRegistry itemRegistry = banco.getItemRegistry();
BancoItem bancoItem = itemRegistry.get(itemStack);

Warning

If there is no BancoItem matching the ItemStack, BancoItem will be null. You must run the necessary checks in your code before proceeding.

You can also check if an ItemStack is a valid BancoItem with BancoItemRegistry::isValid:

boolean isValid = itemRegistry.isValid(itemStack);

docs.title: Adding a BancoItem
docs.text:
You can add a custom BancoItem by extending the interface:

public final class CustomItem implements BancoItem {

    private final Material material = Material.STONE;

    private final BigDecimal value = BigDecimal.valueOf("1");

    @Override
    public BigDecimal value() {
        return value;
    }

    @Override
    public ItemStack asItemStack(int amount) {
        return new ItemStack(material, amount);
    }

}

Lastly, this CustomItem has to be registered:

CustomItem customItem = new CustomItem();
itemRegistry.register(customItem);

docs.title: Unregistering a BancoItem
docs.text:
Although it is not recommended, you may also unregister a BancoItem at any time:

itemRegistry.unregister(customItem);

docs.title: Storage
docs.text: banco provides a BancoStorage interface that you can implement to support other inventories (backpacks, vaults, banks...). There is also BancoInventory and BancoContainer which already contain all the logic to add and remove items.

docs.title: Registering a BancoStorage
docs.text:
An instance of BancoStorage has to be registered in the BancoStorageRegistry for it to work.

BancoInventory customInventory = new CustomInventory();
BancoContainer customContainer = new CustomContainer();

BancoStorageRegistry storageRegistry = banco.getStorageRegistry();
storageRegistry.register(
    customInventory, customContainer
);

docs.title: Unregistering a BancoStorage
docs.text:
Unregistering a BancoStorage at any time is also possible with the BancoStorageRegistry::unregister method, giving developers more control over their implementations.

storageRegistry.unregister(
    customInventory, customContainer
);

docs.title: Friendly names
docs.text:
friendlyName() can be overriden in any BancoStorage implementation. This friendly name gives server owners the possibility of giving priority to your add-on in their settings.yml. For example:

CustomInventory.java
public final class CustomInventory {

    @Override
    public String friendlyName() {
        return "CUSTOM_INVENTORY";
    }

    ...

}
settings.yml
currency:
  inventoryOrder:
  - CUSTOM_INVENTORY # CUSTOM_INVENTORY will be given priority to add/remove balance
  - BUNDLE
  - PLAYER_INVENTORY
  - ENDER_CHEST

docs.title: BancoStorage
docs.text:
An interface that must be implemented with:

  • value(uuid), which returns uuid's stored balance
  • add(uuid, amount), which adds amount to uuid's instance of this storage
  • remove(uuid, amount), which removes amount from uuid's instance of this storage

  • Pros

    Gives developers more control over their storage implementations

    Generally more stable

  • Cons

    Developers have to code their own logic to add and remove balance

docs.title: BancoInventory
docs.text:
An abstract class that must be extended with:

  • get(uuid), which returns uuid's Inventory

  • Pros

    Easiest to implement

    Uses native Bukkit API

  • Cons

    Needs a valid Bukkit Inventory that is stored properly

docs.title: BancoContainer
docs.text:
An abstract class that must be extended with:

  • get(uuid), which returns a list containing every stored ItemStack
  • addItem(uuid, item), which adds item into this container and returns items that could not be added
  • removeItem(uuid, item), which removes item from this container

  • Pros

    Works for almost any use case

  • Cons

    More prone to changes

docs.title: BancoAccountRegisterEvent
docs.text:
This event is called when an account is registered.

Warning

This event cannot be cancelled.

docs.title: account
docs.text: The Account that has been registered. It can be manipulated.

docs.title: BancoAccountUnregisterEvent
docs.text:
This event is called when an account is unregistered.

Warning

This event cannot be cancelled.

docs.title: account
docs.text: The Account that has been unregistered. It can be manipulated.

docs.title: BancoItemRegisterEvent
docs.text:
This event is called when an item is registered.

Warning

This event cannot be cancelled.

docs.title: bancoItem
docs.text: The BancoItem that has been registered. It can be manipulated.

docs.title: BancoItemUnregisterEvent
docs.text:
This event is called when an item is unregistered.

Warning

This event cannot be cancelled.

docs.title: bancoItem
docs.text: The BancoItem that has been unregistered. It can be manipulated.

docs.title: BancoStorageRegisterEvent
docs.text:
This event is called when a storage is registered.

Warning

This event cannot be cancelled.

docs.title: storage
docs.text: The storage that has been registered. It can be manipulated.

docs.title: BancoStorageUnregisterEvent
docs.text:
This event is called when a storage is unregistered.

Warning

This event cannot be cancelled.

docs.title: storage
docs.text: The storage that has been unregistered. It can be manipulated.

docs.title: BancoTransactionEvent
docs.text: This event is called when a transaction is made.

docs.title: account
docs.text: The account that this transaction is using. It cannot be manipulated.

docs.title: amount
docs.text: The amount of balance to be deposited or withdrawn. It will be positive if money is being deposited and negative if it is being withdrawn.

docs.title: Quickstart
docs.text: Before installing banco, take a look at the #Compatibility chart to make sure that your server software is supported.

docs.title: 1. Choosing the right version
docs.text:
Starting with version 0.3, banco is available in two different versions:

Modern (PaperMC, PurpurMC, Pufferfish...): Compatible only with the latest Minecraft version

Legacy (Bukkit, SpigotMC): Supports the latest two major Minecraft versions (for example, Minecraft 1.20 and 1.21), but may not include all available features

docs.title: 2. Dependencies
docs.text: • Vault 1.7+ or VaultUnlocked. Without the Vault API, banco will not do anything on its own

docs.title: 3. Installation
docs.text:
• Like any other plug-in, the downloaded jar file needs to be put in your server's plugins/ folder
  • Start your server at least once to generate a settings.yml file and download the required libraries

docs.title: 4. Add-ons (optional)
docs.text:
banco has some add-ons that expand on its features:

Name Description Author banco-bank-extension Provides compatibility with Bank U8092

docs.title: For administrators
docs.text: Description                                    Permission /banco  Displays information about banco banco.admin /banco reload Reloads settings banco.admin /banco set  Sets 's account balance to  banco.admin /banco give  Deposits  into 's account  banco.admin /banco take  Withdraws  from 's account banco.admin

docs.title: For players
docs.text:
Description   Permission /balance  Shows your account's balance banco.user /balance Shows account's balance banco.user /pay Pays to banco.user

Note for administrators

Commands /balance and /pay can be disabled by modifying settings.yml.

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
When will banco be updated to support the latest version?

banco is an open-source project, so it depends entirely on its contributors. Unfortunately, it's impossible to give an ETA, but you can join our Discord server to track progress and try experimental builds.

The plugin is not working and crashes almost immediately after starting the server

Please, make sure that you have installed Vault.

Where can I report bugs?

Please, before reporting any bugs, make sure that your server is running the latest version of banco. You can check it in-game with command /banco.

If your server is updated you can report bugs in our GitHub repository or our Discord server.

How do I set up banco?

We recommend going through our quickstart guide, which covers a good portion of banco's possibilities and provides practical examples.

Our support team will also help if you are willing to join our Discord server.

Is banco compatible with ...?

There is a list with all compatible and supported plugins on the compatibility page.

docs.title: Compatibility with 3rd party plugins
docs.text: Starting with version 1.0, banco offers native compatibility for a wide range of third-party plugins:

docs.title: Custom Items
docs.text:
banco will recognize and use items provided by these plugins as long as you configure their ID in settings.yml:

  • ItemsAdder (1)
  • Oraxen (2)
  • MythicMobs (3)
  • Nova (4)
  1. Type: itemsadder
  2. Type: oraxen
  3. Type: mythicmobs
  4. Type: nova

docs.title: Example set-up using ItemsAdder
docs.text:
settings.yml
itemRegistry:
- type: itemsadder # (1)!
  identifier: example_identifier # (2)!
  value: '1' # (3)!
  1. You can see types by clicking on the annotations attached above
  2. ID of this item in ItemsAdder's configuration
  3. Economical value that this item will hold

docs.title: PlaceholderAPI
docs.text:
• %banco_balance% - player's balance
  • %banco_symbol% - currency symbol
  • %banco_name_singular% - currency name in singular
  • %banco_name_plural% - currency name in plural
  • %banco_version% - current banco version

docs.title: social
docs.text: • Adds keyword [balance] to show formatted balance in the chat

docs.title: Compatibility with Server Software
docs.text: banco is compatible with almost every Bukkit-based server software. Officially supported are:

docs.title: Compatibility chart
docs.text: Compatible? Version Notes PaperMC ✅ See below Recommended PurpurMC ✅ See below Folia ✅ See below Spigot ✅ 1.20+ Bukkit ✅ 1.20+

docs.title: Differences between Modern and Legacy
docs.text: Supported server software Supported version(s) Notes Modern PaperMC, PurpurMC, Pufferfish... Latest Legacy Bukkit, Spigot... Latest two major May not include all features

docs.title: Adding or removing items
docs.text: banco comes with a very simple and flexible emerald-based economy setup that fits almost any survival server. You can, however, create a new setup very easily by editing settings.yml.

docs.title: Basic configuration
docs.text:
settings.yml
  itemRegistry:
  - type: vanilla
    material: GOLD_INGOT
    value: '1'
  - type: vanilla
    material: GOLD_BLOCK
    value: '9'

Explanation

This is how a simple gold-based economy setup would look like. You can see a full list with every accepted material ID by clicking here.

docs.title: type
docs.text:
Type of this item. Use vanilla if you want to follow this guide. Otherwise, see Using custom items from external plugins

Example 
type: vanilla

docs.title: material
docs.text:
Material ID of this item.

Example 
material: IRON_INGOT

docs.title: value
docs.text:
Economical value that this item will have. It can contain decimal numbers.

Example 
value: '0.1'

docs.title: Customizing vanilla items
docs.text:
You can also customize items with display names, lores, custom model data and other options.

Example showcasing every configurable option
  itemRegistry:
  - type: vanilla
    material: PLAYER_HEAD
    value: '576'
    # Custom tags have to be put in the section below
    customization:
      displayName: <green>Bag of Emerald Blocks</green>
      lore:
      - <gray>Holds <green>64x Emerald Blocks</green></gray>
      customModelData: 1009
      glowEffect: false
      headTextureUrl: http://textures.minecraft.net/texture/31d827a5decb0ae730abb69617776e1894f2bdb46968540433115d3688fbac38
      # Attributes
      attributes:
      - key: minecraft:movement_speed
        amount: -0.05
        operation: MULTIPLY_SCALAR_1
        group: ANY

Explanation

This is a bag of emerald blocks made by using a custom texture player head. It slows down the player holding it by 5% of their total movement speed. Tag customModelData does not do anything in this case, it is there for demonstration purposes.

docs.title: displayName
docs.text:
Display name of this item. It can be formatted with MiniMessage tags.

Example 
displayName: <rainbow>Example Item

docs.title: lore
docs.text:
Lore or description that will be shown when hovering over this item. It can be formatted with MiniMessage tags and contain multiple lines.

Example 
lore:
- <font:myfont:custom_font>Uses a custom font from a resource pack</font>
- <red>Line 2</red>

docs.title: customModelData
docs.text:
Custom model data can be used for changing an item's appearance. It must be a number.

Example 
customModelData: 10007

docs.title: glowEffect
docs.text:
Makes this item look like an enchanted item. Must be true or false.

Example 
glowEffect: true

docs.title: headTextureUrl
docs.text:
When material is set to PLAYER_HEAD, you can customize how the head texture will look like by providing an URL to a skin file.

Example 
headTextureUrl: http://textures.minecraft.net/texture/31d827a5decb0ae730abb69617776e1894f2bdb46968540433115d3688fbac38

docs.title: attributes
docs.text:
Attributes are values that determine certain properties in Minecraft. You can see a full list here.

  • key: Namespaced key of the attribute to modify.
  • amount: +- amount that will be applied to this modification.
  • operation: Operation to perform on this attribute.
  • group: Equipment slot group that will activate this modification.
Example 
attributes:
- key: minecraft:movement_speed
  amount: -0.05
  operation: MULTIPLY_SCALAR_1
  group: ANY

docs.title: Using custom items from external plugins
docs.text: Starting with version 1.0, banco also supports items provided by third party plugins such as ItemsAdder, Oraxen or Nova. Other plugins contains a detailed explanation on how to do this.

docs.title: Translations
docs.text:
banco automatically translates messages based on the user’s language preferences. Currently, it supports the following languages:

Locale Author Catalan (Spain) ca_ES U8092 English (United States) en_US U8092 Spanish (Spain)  es_ES U8092 German (Germany) de_DE Loapu Brazilian Portuguese pt_BR Redyiel Russian (Russia) ru_RU deltathebuilder Simplified Chinese zh_CN SnowCutieOwo

docs.title: Overriding language keys
docs.text:
Starting with version 0.5, language keys can be globally overriden by editing plugins/banco/lang/overrides.properties. This feature is beneficial for users seeking to support additional languages that are currently not implemented.

#
# You can use this file to override language keys
#
# Keys: https://github.com/myth-MC/banco/blob/main/common/src/main/resources/i10n_en_US.properties
#
# Please, consider contributing your translations by opening a pull request in our GitHub repo.
#
# Usage example:
# banco.errors.not-enough-arguments=No hi ha suficients arguments.
#

banco.errors.not-enough-arguments=No hi ha suficientes arguments.
banco.errors.invalid-command=Comanda invàlida.
banco.errors.player-not-found=No s'ha pogut trobar a {0}.
banco.errors.invalid-value={0} no és un valor correcte.
banco.errors.not-enough-funds=No tens suficients diners a l'inventari.

# ...

Note

Please, consider contributing to our translation project by opening a pull request in our GitHub repository. You can also open a thread in #banco-support in our Discord.
